Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Bear Canyon Shopping Center has recently completed an exterior renovation and features a Goodwill Superstore along with The Bloc, which is an indoor climbing and recreational facility. Bear Canyon Shopping Center is
located in the heart of the Tanque Verde Valley which is one of the highest-income areas of Tucson. The shopping center features a Pima County Library branch which generates traffic for the surrounding merchants. The rents and triple net charges for this project are very competitive in the Tucson market and the surrounding trade area. This is an excellent opportunity for a retailer or service tenant to locate in an excellent trade area with very limited
commercial space available.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
Old Spanish Trail Marketplace is located at an intersection considered to be the dominant retail shopping area serving southeast Tucson. It is anchored by Ross Dress for Less, Bed Bath & Beyond, OfficeMax, Ulta and Petco.
Other retailers at the intersection include Super Target, Fry’s, Payless Shoes, Panda Express, Starbucks and Walgreens.

This newly built, ±10,500 SF retail development is located in the heart of the Park Place Mall regional trade area. It benefits from surrounding restaurants and retailers such as Macy’s Sears, Total Wine and More, Dillards, Forever 21, Applebee’s, Red Lobster, Best Buy, Cost Plus World Market, Pier 1 Imports, Savers, LA Fitness, Texas Roadhouse, BevMo, Tuesday Morning, and Famous Footwear. Tucson’s first Corner Bakery Cafe is now open directly north of the subject property. Kneaders Bakery & Cafe, Dick’s Sporting Goods, Nordstrom Rack, and Raising Cane’s recently opened at the intersection. Monument signage available. Property is restricted from restaurant uses.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: River Center is a grocery anchored neighborhood shopping center located in the attractive Catalina Foothills of Tucson, Arizona. River Center is the dominant shopping center in the trade area. The center has limited direct competition and is the only shopping center located within a one mile radius.The center is strategically positioned with an excellent tenant mix of boutique and high end retailers.

Common.Brochures.Common.BrochureName: SILO Public Market_Wilmot-Park Place Tucson AZ.pdf
SILO Public Market_Wilmot-Park Place Tucson AZ.pdf

Common.LocationDescription.Common.Text:
From the moment you arrive and easily park your car, (nearly 300 parking spaces!) or bike, you know SILO Public Market is
different.  This is a mixed-use development featuring 30,000 sf of curated retail, Tucson’s best and most original tenants, next to a 1.1
million sf regional mall, hotels, fitness and residential units,
with an estimated delivery in early 2022.

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text:
SILO Public Market is the essence of community and the champion of Tucson’s leading restaurant and retail entrepreneurs. Curating the best-of-Tucson and embracing the southwest zeal for the outdoors, SILO Public Market invites you to meet up, hang out, and join in with dining, shopping and services. Even in a city as diverse as Tucson, SILO Public Market presents a fresh interpretation of the Arizona spirit. Fostering real connections. Tasteful. Cool. Surprises to entertain. All with indoor-outdoor options , thoughtful materials and a focus on local authenticity. 
RETAIL LIVES! and, its future is at SILO public market.

Common.Strapline.Common.Text: SILO Public Market: At The Entrance To Park Place Mall

Common.LongDescription.Common.Text: This opportunity is located at one of the highest trafficked intersections in Tucson with combined counts of well over 100,000 cars per day. In addition, this property is located next to the University of Arizona with its student population of over 40,000 plus employees and teachers. This is an excellent opportunity for a retailer to locate in Tucson’s central core at a prominent location with excellent visibility and access.

Upscale tenant-mix catering to the surrounding neighborhood demographic. “Going-home” traffic into Oro Valley, Catalina, SaddleBrooke and Pinal County. Signalized intersection with visibility for tenant signage. Busy center across from national retailers like Walmart Neighborhood Market, Sprouts Farmer Market, Home Goods and Kohl’s

Casas Adobes Plaza is a landmark grocery anchored shopping center located in the Casas Adobes neighborhood of Tucson, AZ. The center is located at one of the busiest intersections in the market and serves the two most affluent communities in Tucson; the Catalina Foothills and Oro Valley. Anchored by a newly constructed Whole Foods Market and tenanted with an enviable lineup of some of the nation’s leading retailers such as Pei Wei, Starbucks, Jos A. Banks, Chico’s, Talbot’s and Whole Foods, Casas Adobes Plaza is a landmark retail destination for Tucson’s upscale and affluent consumers.
